duties_responsibilities.duty: Execute assigned project activities using established procedures and applying scientific knowledge and accumulated experience to complete projects involving manipulating human cell lines, microorganism and/or other biological material.
Perform standard microbiological techniques to culture diverse bacterial isolates under aerobic and anaerobic conditions for banking and delivery to clients.
Maintain and optimize the growth of diverse microbes under various conditions and make recommendations to resolve problems encountered while performing procedures.
Summarize experimental results, and review conclusions with supervisor/project leader, may communicate the results of experiments in the form of reports and presentations.
Accountable for electronic records management and use of validated systems ensuring information is recorded in a timely manner, accurately and consistently.
Participate in routine lab maintenance, lab safety, and implementation of safety guidelines and procedures.
Responsible for maintaining an effective scientific knowledge base and effectively using broad scientific concepts to resolve problems of moderate scope and complexity.
Analyze alternative approaches to solve problems or develop new perspectives on existing solutions.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Molecular Biology, Cellular Biology, or Microbiology or related field and 4 years of relevant experience. Master’s Degree in Molecular Biology, Cellular Biology, or Microbiology or related field and 2 years of relevant experience.
